detaileddescription.para: This navigation class constructor sets up our robot to begin navigating a particular map

parameterdescription.para: The EV3LargeRegulatedMotor instance for our left motor
The EV3LargeRegulatedMotor instance for our right motor

detaileddescription.para: This method calculate the angle for the robot to rotate facing certain point
Travel to a point naively: by rotating the robot facing the point first and then go to the point
This method travel the robot to desired position by following the line (Always rotate 90 degree), along with a correction
When avoid=true, the nav thread will handle traveling. If you want to travel without avoidance, this is also possible. In this case, the method in the Navigation class is used.

parameterdescription.para: The x coordinate to travel to (in cm)
The y coordinate to travel to (in cm)
the robot will pay attention to the distance from ultrasonic sensor to avoid abstacle when navigating

detaileddescription.para: Move a certain distance with correction along current direction (using coordinate system)

parameterdescription.para: theta to be corrected each time

detaileddescription.para: This method move the robot one tile until it detect a blackline (ususally one tile)
This method is where the logic for the odometer will run. Use the methods provided from the OdometerData class to implement the odometer.

parameterdescription.para: The angle we want our robot to turn to (in degrees)

detaileddescription.para: found the tunnel based on the ll and ur coordinate, after the method, the robot will go the the entrance of the tunnel facing the tunnel it returns the distance it needs to go for [x] and [y] in order to go through the tunnel

listitem.para: this method approaches the ring set by paying attention to the reading of us sensor, stops at the place when the robot can reach the ring

parameterdescription.para: whether correct the position when searching ring (cannot do this when at boundary)
whether reset the rod motor to the original position

detaileddescription.para: Rotate the robot by certain angle

parameterdescription.para: The angle to rotate our robot to

detaileddescription.para: Move the robot forward
Stop the motor
This method return the direction (up, down, right, left) based on the instruction from the path finder
This method move the robot back until a black line detection
Move the robot until one blackline has been detect

parameterdescription.para: whether consider the case if one sensor does not detect black line (recommend to set to true)

memberdef.argsstring: (ArrayList< int[]> points, int n, int multiplier)
memberdef.name: travelToTunnelEntrance

detaileddescription.para: This method navigate the robot to the entrance of the tunnel
This method allows the conversion of a distance to the total rotation of each wheel need to cover that distance.
This method allows the conversion of an angle value
The Navigator class extends the functionality of the Navigation class. It offers an alternative travelTo() method which uses a state machine to implement obstacle avoidance.

The Navigator class does not override any of the methods in Navigation. All methods with the same name are overloaded i.e. the Navigator version takes different parameters than the Navigation version.

This is useful if, for instance, you want to force travel without obstacle detection over small distances. One place where you might want to do this is in the ObstacleAvoidance class. Another place is methods that implement specific features for future milestones such as retrieving an object.
